body_html:
I'd rather not have to move files around that sounds prone to bugs. Is it possible to just define a filter of the pytorch repo so that we end up with: aten/ cmake/ and nothing else and have the build inside the aten folder still work? I don't think people will care that we added an extra folder level.
…
On Thu, Apr 12, 2018 at 11:31 AM, Edward Z. Yang ***@***.***> wrote: As we start bringing together common pieces between PyTorch and Caffe2, it will no longer be the case that the most logical place for a third party library or a cmake to live is in the aten/ folder. This has implications for ATen mirroring, because it means that if you have *only* the ATen subdirectory, that is not sufficient to build. In this case, we need to copy depended upon files (e.g., cmake/Modules_CUDA_fix) into the root dir when we do the mirror, and test for the file in both locations. body:
I'd rather not have to move files around that sounds prone to bugs. Is it
possible to just define a filter of the pytorch repo so that we end up with:

aten/
cmake/

and nothing else and have the build inside the aten folder still work?

I don't think people will care that we added an extra folder level.
